summary: Completed frontend testing for Rumack-Matthew Nomogram coordinate rewrite. All 4 test cases PASSED - coordinate mapping is accurate with points appearing at correct positions on the treatment line.
passed_tests: TEST 1: 4 hours, 150 mcg/mL - Point appears exactly on treatment line starting point (150 label on Y-axis) - PASSED
TEST 2: 12 hours, 37 mcg/mL - Point appears on treatment line midway through chart - PASSED
TEST 3: 24 hours, 5 mcg/mL - Point appears at bottom right corner on treatment line end - PASSED
TEST 4: 8 hours, 100 mcg/mL - Point appears above treatment line with PROBABLE HEPATOTOXICITY warning - PASSED
TEST 5: Result box shows correct treatment threshold values (150 at 4h, 37 at 12h, 5 at 24h, 70 at 8h) - PASSED
TEST 6: Result box shows correct recommendations (ABOVE TREATMENT LINE - START NAC, PROBABLE HEPATOTOXICITY - START NAC IMMEDIATELY) - PASSED
critical_code_review_comments: AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Coordinate mapping correctly uses TRANSFORM matrix from SVG (scale 0.76671865, 0.76694206, translate 1.1857538, 5.0148173)

AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: RAW_COORDS reference points correctly extracted from SVG Y-axis labels (1000@y=100, 500@y=170.57, 200@y=272.39, 150@y=302.18, 100@y=347.39, 50@y=424.48, 10@y=599.35, 5@y=673.57)
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: X-axis mapping correct (hour 4 at x=150, hour 24 at x=650, 25px per hour)
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: yScaleSVG function correctly implements logarithmic interpolation between known Y-axis points
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Point color correctly changes based on toxicity level (green for below, orange for above treatment, red for probable toxicity)
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Pulsing animation on point provides good visibility
context_for_next_testing_agent: Rumack-Matthew Nomogram coordinate mapping verified with 4 test cases. Navigation: Login -> I Agree -> Children card -> Approaches -> Acetaminophen Overdose dropdown -> Rumack-Matthew Nomogram section -> Switch to mcg/mL -> Enter hours and level values. Key reference points: Treatment line starts at 4h/150mcg, passes through 12h/37mcg, ends at 24h/5mcg. Probable toxicity line at 4h/200mcg, 8h/100mcg. Point colors: green (below treatment), orange (above treatment), red (probable toxicity).
